episodeTitle: Keep Shirahoshi Safe! Decken Close Behind!
episodeTitleJapanese: しらほしを守れ デッケンの追撃
episodeTitleRomanized: Shirahoshi o Mamore - Dekken no Tsuigeki
description: Sanji petrifies after seeing Shirahoshi's beauty. Luffy, Chopper, and Hatchan are captured by local fish-men who believe they're kidnapping the princess. When Vander Decken IX appears and proposes to Shirahoshi, she rejects him, prompting Luffy to defeat him with a new Gear Second technique before escaping to the Sea Forest.

events.title: Sanji Petrifies Upon Seeing Shirahoshi
events.description: Despite Chopper's desperate pleas for him not to turn around, Sanji finally looks at Princess Shirahoshi and is instantly petrified by her overwhelming beauty. This comedic moment showcases Sanji's extreme reaction to beautiful women, taken to its logical extreme.
events.significance: A memorable comedic moment that demonstrates Sanji's character trait of being overwhelmed by beautiful women, while also establishing Shirahoshi's legendary beauty that has been built up throughout the arc.

quotes.text: Sanji! Don't turn around! You'll die if you see her!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper desperately trying to prevent Sanji from seeing Shirahoshi

events.title: Luffy and Crew Captured by Fish-Men
events.description: Luffy, Chopper, Hatchan, and the petrified Sanji are captured and tied up by local fish-men warriors who believe Luffy is kidnapping Princess Shirahoshi. The locals refuse to listen to Shirahoshi's attempts to explain that Luffy was helping her, and they promise to behead the pirates.
events.significance: Creates tension and conflict as the Straw Hats are seen as enemies by the very people they're trying to help, demonstrating the deep-seated mistrust between humans and fish-men.

quotes.text: Release the princess at once, you pirates! We'll have your heads for this!
quotes.speaker: Fish-Man Warriors
quotes.context: The local fish-men accusing Luffy of kidnapping Shirahoshi

events.title: Vander Decken IX Confronts Shirahoshi in Person
events.description: Vander Decken IX appears before Shirahoshi for the first direct confrontation, shocking the local fish-men who realize he was the one who had been throwing deadly objects at the princess for years. His presence creates immediate alarm among everyone present.
events.significance: The first time Vander Decken confronts Shirahoshi face-to-face after years of threatening her from afar, escalating the danger and bringing his obsession to a head.

events.title: Vander Decken's Marriage Proposal
events.description: Vander Decken IX asks Shirahoshi to marry him, saying she will escape death if she says yes. This shocks the locals who find it absurd after his constant attempts on her life. Shirahoshi politely but firmly rejects him, saying he is 'not her type,' which stuns everyone as they realize that's why she won't marry him, not his violent tendencies.
events.significance: Reveals the twisted nature of Decken's obsession with Shirahoshi - his love and murder attempts are two sides of the same coin. Shirahoshi's rejection triggers his decision to kill her if he can't have her.

quotes.text: Marry me, Shirahoshi! Say yes, and you'll escape death!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX

quotes.text: I'm sorry, but... you're not my type.
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Shirahoshi politely rejecting Vander Decken's proposal

quotes.text: I've had feelings for you for the past ten years, and you stepped all over them! Your existence is now an eyesore!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer Debut
events.description: While tied up, Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer technique, a Gear Second version of his Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi. He wraps his legs around Vander Decken IX at extreme speed and smashes him headfirst into the ground with devastating force, shocking all the witnesses.
events.significance: The debut of a new Gear Second technique, demonstrating Luffy's post-timeskip strength and his ability to protect others even while restrained. This technique shows Luffy's creative adaptation of his Devil Fruit abilities.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of the Jet Hammer technique

events.title: Wadatsumi Attempts to Stop the Escape
events.description: The Straw Hats attempt to escape on Megalo with Shirahoshi, but the giant pufferfish fish-man Wadatsumi prepares to punch them. Before Wadatsumi can attack, Luffy strikes first with a Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol, hitting him in the face and breaking one of his teeth.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's superior speed and combat prowess post-timeskip, easily countering the enormous Wadatsumi who was a major threat to the group.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy striking Wadatsumi before he can attack

events.title: Escape to the Sea Forest
events.description: Luffy, Chopper, Hatchan, Sanji, and Shirahoshi successfully escape on Megalo (Shirahoshi's pet shark) as they flee toward the Sea Forest. Vander Decken begins to recover from Luffy's attack and swats away the fish-men trying to capture him, preparing to give chase.
events.significance: Marks the transition to the next phase of the arc as the group heads to the Sea Forest where they will meet Jinbe and learn crucial information about Fish-Man Island's history.

events.title: Nami and Camie Escape Ryugu Palace
events.description: Nami and Camie successfully escape from Ryugu Palace. Someone informs Hody Jones of their escape, but he dismisses it as unimportant. Nami rides on Camie's back with an air bubble around her head, asking Camie to take her to the Sea Forest to meet Jinbe.
events.significance: Sets up the reunion at the Sea Forest and shows Nami's determination to confront Jinbe about Arlong, demonstrating her emotional investment in understanding the history between fish-men and humans.

quotes.text: Camie, please take me to the Sea Forest. I need to meet Jinbe.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami asking Camie to take her to meet Jinbe

events.title: Zoro Seemingly Defeats Hody Jones
events.description: At Ryugu Palace, Zoro uses his Lion Strike (Shishi Sonson) technique on Hody Jones, seemingly defeating the captain of the New Fish-Man Pirates. The battle demonstrates Zoro's overwhelming strength even underwater, where fish-men should have the advantage.
events.significance: Showcases Zoro's post-timeskip power, demonstrating that even in water where fish-men are strongest, he can decisively defeat opponents. However, this victory is temporary as Hody will later return powered by Energy Steroids.

events.title: Neptune Recognizes the Energy Steroids Threat
events.description: King Neptune demonstrates concern for his people by recognizing that the Energy Steroids could be a real threat to Fish-Man Island's safety. This understanding shows his wisdom as a ruler and foreshadows the danger these drugs pose.
events.significance: Establishes the Energy Steroids as a major threat and shows Neptune's care for his kingdom. This foreshadows the devastating effects these drugs will have on Hody Jones and his crew.

quotes.text: I'm sorry, but... you're not my type.
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Shirahoshi's polite rejection of Vander Decken's marriage proposal

quotes.text: I've had feelings for you for the past ten years, and you stepped all over them!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX
quotes.context: Decken's rage after being rejected by Shirahoshi

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's debut of a new Gear Second technique to defeat Vander Decken

themes.description: The episode explores the dangerous nature of obsessive love through Vander Decken's pursuit of Shirahoshi. His inability to accept rejection transforms his claimed 'love' into murderous intent, highlighting the dark side of obsession.
themes.symbolism: Vander Decken's marriage proposal while simultaneously threatening death represents the toxic nature of possessive love that sees the object of affection as property rather than a person.

themes.description: Luffy's determination to protect Shirahoshi even while bound demonstrates true heroism - protecting others without expectation of reward or recognition. His actions contrast sharply with Decken's possessive 'protection' offer.
themes.symbolism: Luffy fighting while tied up symbolizes that true strength comes from the will to protect others, not just physical freedom or power.

themes.description: The local fish-men's immediate assumption that Luffy is kidnapping Shirahoshi reflects the deep mistrust between humans and fish-men. Despite Shirahoshi's protests, they refuse to believe a human pirate could be helping her.
themes.symbolism: The ropes binding Luffy represent the constraints that prejudice places on understanding and cooperation between different peoples.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his post-timeskip strength by debuting a new Gear Second technique while protecting Shirahoshi. His unwavering determination to help her despite being captured shows his heroic nature.
keyActions: Debuts Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer technique
Defeats Vander Decken IX while tied up
Escapes with Shirahoshi to the Sea Forest

characterSpotlights.development: Shirahoshi shows character growth by firmly but politely rejecting Vander Decken's proposal despite the danger. Her trust in Luffy demonstrates her growing courage to face her fears rather than hide in her tower.
keyActions: Attempts to explain to the fish-men that Luffy is helping her
Escapes with Luffy on Megalo to the Sea Forest
quotes: I'm sorry, but... you're not my type.

characterSpotlights.development: Vander Decken's true nature is revealed as his 'love' for Shirahoshi is exposed as possessive obsession. His violent reaction to rejection shows that his feelings were never about Shirahoshi's happiness, only his own desire.
keyActions: Is defeated by Luffy's Jet Hammer
quotes: Marry me, Shirahoshi! Say yes, and you'll escape death!
I've had feelings for you for the past ten years, and you stepped all over them!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's extreme reaction to Shirahoshi's beauty provides comedic relief while also emphasizing the mermaid princess's legendary appearance that has been built up throughout the arc.
keyActions: Turns to stone upon seeing Shirahoshi
Remains petrified throughout most of the episode

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Zoro's battle with Hody Jones, showing a more prolonged struggle compared to the manga's brief encounter.
Sanji's petrification scene was extended in the anime with more comedic reactions from Chopper and additional visual gags.

trivia.fact: This episode's TV rating was 10.4%, ranking 5th in viewership for that week in Japan.
The Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer technique debuted in this episode is the Gear Second version of Luffy's earlier Gomu Gomu no Ozuchi (Gum-Gum Mallet) technique.

Voice actors Wataru Takagi (Vander Decken IX Japanese) and Jim Foronda (English) also voice Claptrap from Borderlands in their respective languages, creating an interesting connection between the two actors.

sources.title: Jim Foronda on X about Vander Decken voice acting

trivia.fact: This episode covers Chapter 618, pages 3-19 of the manga.
The opening 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was created by the same 'Golden Team' that created the iconic first opening 'We Are!' - marking the return of this creative team for the post-timeskip era.
